passages.text:
Robert::Leslie,

Robert::I apologize for the last minute change in plans, but we’ve got to pull the posters for the new play.  Don’t distribute them tomorrow.  

Robert::We’ll have the new design finished by the end of the week.

Robert::Best, Robert.

[[C->page2]]
passages.name: page1

passages.text:
Leslie::What the fuck?  The posters are scheduled to go up in six hours.  We've been planning this for months.

Leslie::Did one of the actors sleep with Tann's wife again?  Or end up on Rosalind's shit list?

Leslie::I hope there is a very good fucking reason for this.

[[C->page3]]
passages.name: page2

passages.text:
Robert::I'm sorry, Leslie.  It's one of our actresses.  Julia.

Robert::She's pregnant.  Obviously pregnant.  We've all been pretending not to notice but she's bulging so much, it's disgusting.

Robert::We made the call to take her out of the play today.  But she's all over the posters, we've got to redo them

[[C->page4]]
passages.name: page3

passages.text:
Leslie::Fuck, fine.  Send me a photograph of the new actress’s head.  We'll just slap it on the existing posters, that will save some time.

Leslie::You could have just told me the star was pregnant, you know.

[[p:Jeez.  These guys sound horrible.]]
[[p:Why were they so mean to Julia?  Who cares if she was pregnant?]]

links.name: p:Why were they so mean to Julia?  Who cares if she was pregnant?
links.link: p:Why were they so mean to Julia?  Who cares if she was pregnant?

passages.name: page4

passages.text:
A loosely stacked sheet of papers roosts on the desk before you.  A slight curl in their form suggests they were delivered through pneumatic lines.

The pages smell strongly of mold, and the linings are heavily worn.  However, the inscribed text remains perfectly legible.

A glance reveals they appear to be internal communications between two administrators involved with the theater department.

[[p:(Action) Read the exchange.->page1]]
[[p:(Action) Leave.]]
passages.name: Untitled Passage 4

passages.text:
Wiggly::They certainly sound like they lack compassion.  

Wiggly::I hate it when people have to be mean...

[[p:Why are they so disgusted at her for being pregnant?  This is a hospital isn't it?]]

links.name: p:Why are they so disgusted at her for being pregnant?  This is a hospital isn't it?
links.link: p:Why are they so disgusted at her for being pregnant?  This is a hospital isn't it?

passages.name: p:Jeez.  These guys sound horrible.

passages.text:
Wiggly::I think it has to do more with who she was.  A lot of the people here looked down on the nurses - especially the ones who worked in Maternity.

Wiggly::I never really understood why.

[[p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.]]

links.name: p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.
links.link: p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.

passages.name: p:Why are they so disgusted at her for being pregnant?  This is a hospital isn't it?

passages.text:
Wiggly::I don't know.  Maybe they were worried about whether she would fit into some of the costumes they had picked out for her?

Wiggly::Actually, it probably to do more with who she was.  A lot of the people here looked down on the nurses - especially the ones who worked in Maternity.

Wiggly::I never really understood why.

[[p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.]]

links.name: p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.
links.link: p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.

passages.name: p:Why were they so mean to Julia?  Who cares if she was pregnant?

passages.text:
Wiggly::Hmm, yeah, doesn't really leave us with much helpful info.

Wiggly::Let's keep looking.
passages.name: p:I don't like that she was treated this way.  But I'm not sure this exchange really tells us much.
